name: places/ChIJTfdYTv1YwokRIX4XDFc16YE
formattedAddress: 757 3rd Ave Suite 1202, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 757 3rd Ave Suite 1202, New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text: One of the worse recruiting and staffing agencies in existence. I have been contacted by many recruiters over the years and have never once had a full through hiring experience without being ghosted. The furthest I've ever gotten with a Teksystems recruiter is the initial phone call or emails. They will all ghost you. All of them. This is a horrible agency that does not care about any of the clients they contact. Some of the awful recruiters include: Nicholas Cuomo, Matthew Rea and Carly Scarlato.

originalText.text:
I have dealt with different recruiting agencies but this is the most unethical and unprofessional agency.
1- Very Low Pay: they paid 25$/hr for hectic job while full time employees are getting paid around 6 figures. No benefits and they force unpaid days off.

2- Liars: account Manager John spring promised conversion from Contract to full time within 6-8 months. Based on their promises i left my old job 38$/hr since this position i like and i will also have a good salary full time position. After i already quit my old job, i find out that conversion is not guarantee at all since there will be many other factors in place that John Spring never mentioned ( Department fund, contract between the company and their customer renewal…)  and he never actively provided the road to conversion even though we asked multiple times for it.

3- Unethical: We was promised if things doesn’t work out with current company that they will help us with finding other jobs. Unfortunately 1 month before the contract end John spring informed us that there will be no conversation. Him and his team in this month they did not show any help or assistance on finding a new job and they just did not care at this point.

originalText.text: 10/10 would not recommend this agency. I worked with them for approximately 9 months and from the beginning it was a horrible experience. During my first month with them, payroll forgot to submit my paperwork causing a one-month delay in my pay. They took their time to rectify the situation and each time I called to inquire about an update I was met with attitude from members in their office. Also, while working with this agency I experienced discrimination and harassment from their client. After receiving glowing remarks and letters of recommendation, I was publicly embarrassed by a member of the client's team when they disclosed my employment status with the organization. To add salt to my open wound, the team leader from the organization told me “They want to ensure they are giving an FTE position because I deserve it and not because I was a black woman”. I reported this incident to my recruiter from TEKSYSTEM and he didn’t offer anything help. Instead, I was told if the position is challenging my mental health I should leave. I felt helpless during this situation and eventually reported it to the client's HR. As expected, HR did nothing. Just save yourself a headache and stay away.

originalText.text:
I was contacted by this company, didn’t even apply for a job. They made me an offer. The recruiter named Nick who was based in Milwaukee lied and said all I needed to do was wait on some red tape.

There was never an offer. He made me blow off a legitimate offer from another company. A recruiter named Juan who works in Media and Entertainment then stopped responding to Nick’s emails. So Nick told me there was no longer an offer.

This is amateur hour. You blocked my offer because Juan wanted commission. You lied about having it surely because Nick wanted commission. Neither party cared that they were messing with my actual life. A complete waste of time.

originalText.text: Was hired for two different jobs and was relieved of my duties after working 70 hr weeks on a consistent basis because the client did not follow the current CDC guidelines. They do not go to bat for you under any circumstances. Was hired for a following position in basically another state in which I communicated if I did take the position will there be a WFH aspect seeing my commute was a minimum of 2 hours each way daily and was assured there would be. The client went back on its original offer stating they no longer wanted a WFH aspect and laid me off all within 3 weeks of starting and no one from TekSystems lifted a finger for me. Recruiters just plug in a body and walk away just waiting for their comp.
